doc.title: id

value.content:
XSLT/XPath Reference: XSLT elements, EXSLT functions, XPath functions, XPath axes

The id function finds nodes matching the given ids and returns a node-set containing the identified nodes.

value.title: Arguments
value.content:
expression

If expression is a node-set, then the string value of each node in the node-set is treated as an individual id. The returned node set is the nodes corresponding to those ids. If expression is a string, or anything other than a node-set, then expression is treated as a space-separated list of ids. The returned node set is the nodes corresponding to those ids.

value.title: Returns
value.content: A node-set containing the node or nodes identified by the given id or ids.

value.title: Notes
value.content: • The DTD of the XML document determines what attribute is an ID. See XPath 1.0 5.2.1

doc.summary: The id function finds nodes matching the given ids and returns a node-set containing the identified nodes.
